TopicTitle: BASPM is the most cheating game i ever played, and i tell you why!

Articles.Content:
I want send suborbital crewed vostok not but no i cannot despite vostok is 85% and did both uncrewed sub orbital and Sputnik-Korabl bisosatelite no matter how many i repeat i fails to lunch damn vostok despite capsule is 85% and rocket has 95%

Is any cheat to this game?,

because i never had moral problem with cheating the cheater

I wonder does BASPM is scripted or have any random factor?

Try hiring more experienced mission controllers and astronauts, they impact the manned missions and can heavily reduce your reliability if they are not enough trained. I helped to work on the scripts as a contributor, and while the early versions didn't emphasize the skills of mission control and the astronauts that much, the new versions have them heavily impact the success of the mission.

Random factors can be more controlled with increased reliability too, but inflight events require participation of mission control and crew.

Edited September 25, 2014 by NASAFanboy

What's BASPM?

Buzz Aldrin's Space Program Manager

I want send suborbital crewed vostok not but no i cannot despite vostok is 85% and did both uncrewed sub orbital and Sputnik-Korabl bisosatelite no matter how many i repeat i fails to lunch damn vostok despite capsule is 85% and rocket has 95%

Is any cheat to this game?,

because i never had moral problem with cheating the cheater

I wonder does BASPM is scripted or have any random factor?

Are you launching separate rockets and failing each launch or are you reloading the game? Some games keep the random probability 'dice rolls' saved inside the game save to avoid save scumming....

Edited September 27, 2014 by Awaras

Are you launching separate rockets and failing each launch or are you reloading the game? Some games keep the random probability 'dice rolls' saved inside the zacrtane to avoid save scumming....

"save scumming ?"
Looks like a clone of KSP. Anyone any more info about it?

"save scumming ?"

Repeatedly loading a save every time something bad happens, and saving every time something good happens.

Repeatedly loading a save every time something bad happens, and saving every time something good happens.

Does is bad?

Does is bad?

It won't have any effect on the chances.

You should scrub flight if it doesn't go well and if you have a save. The game keeps the reliability and will come up with same failures.

Looks like a clone of KSP. Anyone any more info about it?

Not a clone of KSP.

This is what it's based off of: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buzz_Aldrin%27s_Race_Into_Space

And you can play BARIS here: http://www.raceintospace.org/

Are you launching separate rockets and failing each launch or are you reloading the game? Some games keep the random probability 'dice rolls' saved inside the zacrtane to avoid save scumming....

That is pretty smart, but something you really want to communicate to the people playing.

Looks like a clone of KSP. Anyone any more info about it?

Absolutely not a clone, as said above. This game focuses on real management, personnel micro-management, hardware R&D etc... With quite a huge selection of historical US and Soviet hardware. If you played and liked BARIS (Buzz Aldrin's Race Into Space, 1993), you're going to love it.

There's an official forum there : http://www.slitherine.com/forum/viewforum.php?f=226

Are you launching separate rockets and failing each launch or are you reloading the game? Some games keep the random probability 'dice rolls' saved inside the zacrtane to avoid save scumming....

It does, and yes skilled Mission Controllers are what ultimately make the difference.

It will be released the 31st of October, on Steam too I think.

Edited October 21, 2014 by N_Molson

Go to AppData/LocalLow/MatrixGames/BASPM

You can find your saves there and you can edit the prestige, money, reliability of your programs and you can also spawn some new employees that are superhumans (100 in every branch)
